question: Which four countries represent the neolithic "Shulaveri-Shomu Culture"?
explanation: Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and northern Iran represent the neolithic "Shulaveri-Shomu Culture". Shulaveri-Shomu culture is a Late Neolithic/Eneolithic culture that existed on the territory of present-day Georgia, Azerbaijan, and Armenia, as well as parts of northern Iran. The culture is dated to the mid-6th or the early-5th millennium BC and is thought to be one of the earliest known Neolithic cultures. Shulaveri-Shomu culture covers the 6th-5th millennia BC. According to the material culture examples found in the sites depict that the main activities of the population were farming and breeding.
